thread.title: Gambling commission investigates goalkeeper Wayne Shaw's sideline pie eating
thread.title_full: Gambling commission investigates goalkeeper Wayne Shaw's sideline pie eating

title: Gambling commission investigates goalkeeper Wayne Shaw's sideline pie eating
text:
Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email Gambling commission investigates goalkeeper Wayne Shaw's sideline pie eating The Sutton United goalkeeper who became an Internet hit after eating a pie on the bench during the second half of his club’s 2-0 loss to Arsenal might end up with, well, pie on his face. Post to Facebook Gambling commission investigates goalkeeper Wayne Shaw's sideline pie eating The Sutton United goalkeeper who became an Internet hit after eating a pie on the bench during the second half of his club’s 2-0 loss to Arsenal might end up with, well, pie on his face. Check out this story on USATODAY.com: http://usat.ly/2m3TyLZ Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Gambling commission investigates goalkeeper Wayne Shaw's sideline pie eating USA TODAY Sports 8:04 a.m. ET Feb. 21, 2017 Sutton United goalkeeper Wayne Shaw. (Photo: Glyn Kirk, AFP/Getty Images) 8 CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
The Sutton United goalkeeper who became an Internet hit after eating a pie on the bench during the second half of his club’s 2-0 loss to Arsenal might end up with, well, pie on his face. 
Britain’s gambling commission is looking into the act after Wayne Shaw admitted he knew people could place bets, at 8-1 odds, against him eating a pie on the bench during the match, according to The Guardian . 
He made no secret after the match he knew about the odds. 
“A few of the lads said to me earlier on: ‘What is going on with the 8-1 about eating a pie?’ I said: ‘I don’t know, I’ve eaten nothing all day, so I might give it a go later on,’” Shaw said. “Sun Bets had us at 8-1 to eat a pie. I thought I would give them a bit of banter and let’s do it. All the subs were on and we were 2-0 down. 
“I went and got it at half time from the kitchen, I had it all prepared and ready to go. It was meat and potato,” added Shaw. 
The head of the gambling commission said an investigation had started to make sure the gambling house, Sun Bets, had acted with “integrity.” 
“Integrity in sport is not a joke and we have opened an investigation to establish exactly what happened,” Richard Watson told The Guardian. “As part of that we’ll be looking into any irregularity in the betting market and establishing whether the operator has met its license requirement to conduct its business with integrity.”
